body_html:
Im glad the issue is resolved for you.
For the issue with Jupyter/Spyder, it sounds to me like a setup issue with Jupyter.

Github is a direct channel to tensorflow developers for reporting bugs in tensorflow itself.
It sounds like you are having some problems with Python/Jupyter/Spyder setup, which are standalone pieces of software themselves.
I recommend reaching out to stackoverflow for general help with these software, or looking into product forums to see what is the best way to setup jupyter and set it up to use a specific conda environment you are creating.

It sounds like you are having some problems with Python/Jupyter/Spyder setup, which are standalone pieces of software themselves.

body:
Im glad the issue is resolved for you.
For the issue with Jupyter/Spyder, it sounds to me like a setup issue with Jupyter.

Github is a direct channel to tensorflow developers for reporting bugs in tensorflow itself.
It sounds like you are having some problems with Python/Jupyter/Spyder setup, which are standalone pieces of software themselves.
I recommend reaching out to stackoverflow for general help with these software, or looking into product forums to see what is the best way to setup jupyter and set it up to use a specific conda environment you are creating.
